patterns: can you tell me something about cataract
responses: Cataract is a common eye condition characterized by the clouding of the lens, which leads to blurry vision and, if left untreated, can eventually cause vision loss. The lens of the eye is normally clear and allows light to pass through to the retina, where it is converted into visual signals sent to the brain. However, with cataracts, the lens becomes cloudy, obstructing the passage of light and causing visual impairment.

patterns: can you tell me something about jaundice
responses: Jaundice is a medical condition characterized by yellowing of the skin, eyes, and mucous membranes. It occurs when there is an excess buildup of bilirubin in the body, a yellow pigment produced during the breakdown of red blood cells. Normally, the liver processes bilirubin and excretes it through bile, which is then eliminated from the body through feces. However, when something disrupts this process, bilirubin can accumulate, leading to jaundice.The main symptom of jaundice is the yellow discoloration of the skin, eyes, and mucous membranes. Depending on the underlying cause, individuals with jaundice may also experience other symptoms such as fatigue, abdominal pain, dark urine, pale stools, fever, and itching.

patterns: can you tell me something about Strabismus
responses: Strabismus, commonly referred to as crossed eyes or squint, is a visual condition in which the eyes do not align properly. It occurs when the eye muscles that control eye movement and alignment do not work together correctly, causing one eye to look in a different direction than the other. As a result, the eyes may appear misaligned or one eye may turn inward, outward, upward, or downward while the other remains focused straight ahead.
